remarks: An Axiom of Choice equivalent.  Given a family ` x ` of mutually disjoint nonempty sets, there exists a set ` y ` containing exactly one member from each set in the family.  Theorem 6M(4) of [Enderton] p. 151.  (Contributed by NM, 14-May-2004.)
statement:
ac8 $p |- ( ( A. z e. x z =/= (/) /\ A. z e. x A. w e. x ( z =/= w -> ( z i^i w ) = (/) ) ) -> E. y A. z e. x E! v v e. ( z i^i y ) ) $.
$d v w x y z $.
